That's fantastic! It's great to hear that you're already established a regular yoga practice and are now looking to tailor it to support your digestive health. Incorporating these poses into your routine can have a profound impact on your overall well-being.

Remember to listen to your body and honor its limitations, especially when introducing new poses or modifying your practice. It's essential to approach yoga with kindness, patience, and self-awareness.

Here are some additional tips to enhance your yoga practice for digestive health:

1. **Practice on an empty stomach**: Try to practice yoga on an empty stomach or at least 2-3 hours after a meal to allow for optimal digestion and reduce discomfort during practice.
2. **Focus on your breath**: Deep, conscious breathing can help stimulate digestion, reduce stress, and promote relaxation. Use your breath to guide you through your practice, especially during the digestive-friendly poses.
3. **Engage your core**: Strengthening your core muscles can help improve digestion, reduce bloating, and support overall gut health. Engage your core during poses like Plow Pose, Seated Forward Fold, and Boat Pose.
4. **Stay hydrated**: Drink plenty of water before, during, and after your practice to help flush out toxins and support digestion.
5. **Make it a habit**: Consistency is key when it comes to yoga and digestive health. Aim to practice yoga at the same time every day or week to make it a habit and maximize the benefits.

By incorporating these tips and the digestive-friendly poses into your practice, you can experience improved digestion, reduced bloating, and a greater sense of overall well-being.

Remember, yoga is a journey, and it's essential to be patient, kind, and compassionate with yourself as you explore its benefits. Keep practicing, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need further guidance!
